overview.description: Tamil Nadu, located in southern India, is known for its ancient temples, Dravidian architecture, and coastal beauty. Established as a state on January 26, 1950, it features attractions like Chennai and Madurai.

top_destinations.name: Chennai
top_destinations.description: The coastal capital with Marina Beach and Fort St. George.
top_destinations.travel_tips: Visit Kapaleeshwarar Temple; enjoy local filter coffee.

top_destinations.name: Madurai
top_destinations.description: Home to the Meenakshi Temple and vibrant markets.
top_destinations.travel_tips: Attend the temple festival; explore Thirumalai Nayakkar Mahal.

top_destinations.name: Ooty
top_destinations.description: A hill station with tea gardens and Ooty Lake.
top_destinations.travel_tips: Take the toy train; carry warm clothes.

culinary_delights.name: Murugan Idli Shop
culinary_delights.description: Known for authentic idli and vada.

culinary_delights.name: Café Coffee Day
culinary_delights.description: Cozy spot for coffee and snacks.

must_visit_spots.name: Marina Beach
must_visit_spots.description: The second longest urban beach in the world.

must_visit_spots.name: Ooty Botanical Gardens
must_visit_spots.description: A scenic garden with rare plants.

must_visit_spots.name: Rameswaram Temple
must_visit_spots.tip: Take a dip in the 22 theerthams.

must_visit_spots.name: Mahabalipuram
must_visit_spots.description: Known for rock-cut temples and shore temple.

travel_essentials.how_to_reach: By road: Chennai is 2,000 km from Delhi (NH48, 30-32 hrs). By train: Chennai Central. By air: Chennai International Airport.
travel_essentials.tips: Carry light clothing; avoid peak summer.
